chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
Against the claim: Because the Father bears witness to the Son.

In the Gospel, Christ himself says: I am the one who bears witness about myself. So, he testifies about himself.

The prophets bore witness to the Son, but are the prophets greater than the Son? The apostles also bore witness to the Son, but are they greater than the Son of God?

Since I've shown that he himself bore witness about himself, there's nothing left for the adversaries to say: I am, says the Son, the one who testifies about myself.
chunks.original_latin:
Contra id quod dicunt: Quia Pater perhibet testimonium
Filio. Ipse Christus dicit in Evangelio: Ego
sum qui testimonium perhibeo de me. Ergo ipse testificatur
de se. Prophetae perhibuerunt Filio testimonium,
nunquid majores sunt prophetae Filio? Apostoli
perhibuerunt testimonium Filio, nunquid majores
sunt apostoli Filio Dei? Sed cum ostenderim
quia ipse sibi perhibuit testimonium, non erit quod
ab adversariis respondeatur: Ego sum, inquit Filius,
qui testificor de me.
